p: Another important behavioural adaptation of isopods towards water loss reduction is the tendency of many species to aggregate ( Allee 1926). Water loss is dramatically reduced by crowding, as shown by several studies on aggregation patterns. Several relevant data have been summarised by Broly et al. (2012, 2013b, 2014, 2015c). Aggregation as a behavioural variation, adaptation can buffer also the effects of changes in microclimate ( Hassall et al. 2010).
